meanings.definition: The solid part of the surface of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The lande beneath our feet felt firm and stable.
meanings.sent2: She loved exploring the vast lande around her home.
meanings.sent3: The lande seemed to whisper stories of ancient times.
meanings.sent4: His dreams often took him to distant landes filled with magic.
meanings.sent5: The lande stretched out endlessly, a canvas of nature's beauty.

meanings.sent1: Their ancestors came from a distant lande across the sea.
meanings.sent2: The lande of dreams was where she longed to visit.
meanings.sent3: In the lande of imagination, anything is possible.
meanings.sent4: His heart belonged to a faraway lande of rolling hills.
meanings.sent5: Exploring new landes always filled her with excitement.

meanings.definition: To bring to or set on land.
meanings.sent1: The sailors planned to lande the cargo at dawn.
meanings.sent2: He carefully maneuvered the boat to lande it safely.
meanings.sent3: The astronauts had to lande the spacecraft gently on the moon.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to lande the plane smoothly despite the storm.
meanings.sent5: The pilot skillfully prepared to lande the aircraft on the runway.
